types.description: Representation of a parsed mailbox string (see RFC 5322, section 3.4).

name.description: The <var>display-name</var> associated with the provided address or group, if available.

email.description: The <var>addr-spec</var> associated with the provided address, if available.

group.description: The members of the group, if available.

types.description: MIME headers, which by default are treated as containing one or more mailbox strings.

functions.name: convertToPlainText
functions.description: Converts the provided body to readable plain text, without tags and leading/trailing whitespace.

flowed.description: The converted plain text will be wrapped to lines not longer than 72 characters and use format flowed, as defined by RFC 2646.

functions.name: formatFileSize
functions.description: Returns the provided file size in a human readable format (e.g. <var>12 bytes</var> or <var>11,4 GB</var>).

functions.name: parseMailboxString
functions.description: Parse a mailbox string containing one or more email addresses (see RFC 5322, section 3.4).

parameters.name: mailboxString
parameters.description: The string to be parsed (e.g. <var>User <user@example.com>, other-user@example.com</var>)

parameters.name: preserveGroups
parameters.description: Keep grouped hierachies. Groups may be specified in a mailbox string as follows: <var>GroupName : user1 <user1@example.com>, user2@example,com ;</var>.

functions.name: decodeMimeHeader
functions.description: Decode the provided header into a readable format according to RFC 2047.

parameters.name: isMailBoxHeader
parameters.description: Headers containing multiple mailbox strings need special handling. For example the header <var>=?UTF-8?Q?H=C3=B6rst=2C_Kenny?= <K.Hoerst@invalid>, new@thunderbird.bug</var> will be wrongly decoded to <var>HÃ¶rst, Kenny <K.Hoerst@invalid>, new@thunderbird.bug</var>, corrupting the structure of the first mailbox string. This option overrides the default behavior of treating the headers defined in $(ref:messengerUtilities.MailboxHeaders) as mailbox headers.

functions.name: encodeMimeHeader
functions.description: Encode the provided header according to RFC 2047.
